_meta.title: ICP Discovery Survey
_meta.description: Capture inputs for building an Ideal Customer Profile

questions.label: Who is your primary audience?
questions.hint: Describe the specific type of person or company you serve best
questions.placeholder: e.g., SMB founders in B2B services with 10-50 employees who need to scale operations without adding headcount

questions.label: What company size do you typically serve?
What industries do you serve?
questions.placeholder: e.g., B2B SaaS, Professional Services, E-commerce, Healthcare

questions.label: What geographic markets do you focus on?
questions.placeholder: e.g., US and Canada, English-speaking markets, LATAM expansion

questions.label: What job titles typically buy from you?
questions.hint: List 3-5 titles that make or influence purchase decisions
questions.placeholder: e.g., CEO, COO, VP of Operations, Director of Customer Success

questions.label: What characterizes your ideal buyer psychologically?
questions.hint: Their mindset, values, and decision-making style
questions.placeholder: e.g., Pragmatic, budget-conscious, skeptical of hype, values proven results

questions.label: What budget range indicates a good fit?
What are the top 3-5 pains your customers experience?
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Support team overwhelmed by repetitive questions
Website visitors leaving without converting
Knowledge scattered across tools and people

questions.label: How severe are these pains typically?
questions.hint: Are customers in acute pain or mild discomfort?

questions.label: What hidden costs do these pains create?
questions.placeholder: e.g., $130K/year in support labor, lost deals from slow response times, employee burnout

questions.label: What outcomes do your customers want?
questions.hint: The transformation or results they're seeking
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Instant answers to common questions
More booked calls from website visitors
Faster employee onboarding

questions.label: How do they measure success?
questions.hint: Specific KPIs or metrics they care about
questions.placeholder: e.g., Support ticket deflection rate, time-to-resolution, customer satisfaction score, conversion rate

questions.label: How do prospects typically object about price?
questions.hint: Their exact words when pushing back on cost
questions.placeholder: e.g., "This sounds expensive. We don't have $10K in the budget."

questions.label: How do you typically respond to price objections?
questions.placeholder: e.g., "Let's do the math: if you're handling 100 tickets/week at $25 each..."

questions.label: What other objections do you commonly hear?
questions.placeholder:
e.g., "We don't have bandwidth for this project"
"What if it gives wrong answers?"
"We tried a chatbot before and it failed"

questions.label: What phrases do your customers actually use?
questions.hint: The exact words they say when describing their problems
questions.placeholder:
e.g., "Support is killing us"
"We answer the same questions all day"
"Everything is in WhatsApp"

questions.label: What jargon confuses your customers?
questions.hint: Technical terms they don't understand or use
questions.placeholder: e.g., RAG, embeddings, vector database, LLM

questions.label: What signals indicate someone is a great fit?
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Has a clear problem costing them money
Willing to invest appropriately
Realistic expectations about what's possible

questions.label: What signals indicate someone is NOT a fit?
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Looking for the cheapest option
Expects guaranteed results
Unrealistic timeline expectations

questions.label: What events trigger a purchase decision?
questions.hint: Circumstances that make them ready to buy
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Support backlog reaches breaking point
Lost a major deal due to slow response
New budget window opens
